workflowInfo.workflowDescription: This workflow is used to configure the Cross Memory Server

variable.name: zowe_install_path
variable.label: Install Path
variable.abstract: Path for the Zowe runtime installation
variable.description: Specify the path that was used for the ZOWE runtime installation

string.errorMessage: Specify proper full USS path ending without a trailing slash.

variable.name: zowe_dsn_prefix
variable.label: Zowe Data Set Prefix
variable.abstract: Data Set HLQ for the Zowe runtime installation
variable.description: Specify the data set high level qualifier that was used for the Zowe runtime installation

variable.name: xmem_volume
variable.label: Cross Memory Server Volume
variable.abstract: Fill in the VOLUME for the data sets
variable.description: Use this variable to fill in the VOLUME used for the data set creation (if needed)

variable.name: xmem_storclas
variable.label: Cross Memory Server Storage Class
variable.abstract: Fill in the Storage Class for SMS managed PDS
variable.description: Fill in the Storage Class for SMS managed PDS (if needed)

variable.name: proclib

variable.abstract: Specify the procedure library for the started task
variable.description: Specify the PROCLIB data set name that will be used to store the customized Cross Memory Server STC JCL

variable.name: temp_folder
variable.label: Temporary Folder
variable.abstract: USS folder used to store temporary data
variable.description: This folder will be used to store data required for the workflow execution

string.errorMessage: USS folder path should start and end with slash.

step.name: define_variables
step.title: Define Variables
step.description: Define the variable values for the execution
step.instructions: Run this step to define the variables for the workflow execution.

step.name: allocate_xmem
step.title: Allocate Cross Memory Server Data Sets
step.description: Allocates the data sets for the Cross Memory Server.
step.instructions: Use this step to allocate the data sets required for Cross Memory Server

step.name: copy_artifacts
step.title: Copy artifacts
step.description: Copies the necessary artifacts (load modules, parmlib members, etc). Also copies the STC to the proclib.
step.instructions: Run this step to populate the previously allocated data sets and copy the STC procedures.

step.name: ppt_entries
step.title: Add PPT entries to the system PARMLIB
step.description: Follow the instructions to add the PTT entries to the system parmlib
step.instructions:
The cross memory server and its auxiliary address spaces must run in key 4 and be non-swappable. For the server to start in this environment, add the following PPT entries for the server and address spaces to the SCHEDxx member of the system PARMLIB.

PPT PGMNAME(ZWESIS01) KEY(4) NOSWAP

PPT PGMNAME(ZWESAUX) KEY(4) NOSWAP

The PDS member SZWESAMP(ZWESISCH) contains the PPT lines for reference.

Then, issue the following command to make the SCHEDxx changes effective:

/SET SCH=xx

More info here, step 2.

step.name: volume_retrieve
step.title: Retrieve the LOADLIB volume
step.description: Automatically retrieves VOLUME for non-SMS LOADLIB

condition.description: This step is skipped if VOLUME or Storage Class are known

step.instructions: Run this step to retrieve the actual VOLUME of the LOADLIB

step.name: apf_auth
step.title: APF Authorize Load Library
step.description: This step will dynamically APF authorize the Cross Memory Server LOADLIB
step.instructions: Run this step to dynamically APF authorize the load library. If you want the APF, to be permanent, add following library to your system authorization: ${instance-zowe_dsn_prefix}.SZWEAUTH

step.name: start_xmem
step.title: Start the Cross Memory Server server
step.description: This step starts the Cross Memory Server
step.instructions: Run this step to start the Cross Memory Server. You can also do it manually with the following operator command: S ZWESISTC,REUSASID=YES To stop the Cross Memory Server use this operator command: P ZWESISTC
